1.verse: Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace.

2.verse: We continually give thanks to God for all of you, making mention of you in our prayers, unceasingly

3.verse: remembering before our God and Father your work of faith, your labor of love and the steadfastness of your hope in our Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: We know, brothers loved by God, that he has chosen you,

5.verse: because our gospel did not come to you with words only, but also with power—with the Holy Spirit and full conviction—as you know what kind of men we were among you for your sakes.

6.verse: And you became imitators of us and of the Lord, for you accepted the word in the midst of much affliction, with the joy of the Holy Spirit.

7.verse: So you became an example for all the believers in Macedonia and in Achaia.

8.verse: The word of the Lord has echoed forth from you not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but in every place your faith in God has become known, so we have no need to say anything.

9.verse: For they themselves report regarding us what kind of reception we had among you, and how you turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God,

10.verse: and to wait for his Son from heaven, whom he raised from the dead, Jesus, our deliverer from the coming wrath.

1.verse: For you yourselves know, brothers, that our coming to you was not in vain.

2.verse: We had previously suffered and been shamefully treated in Philippi, as you know, but we had the courage in our God to declare to you the gospel of God in spite of great opposition.

3.verse: For our appeal was not based on deceit, nor did it rise from impure motives or by way of trickery,

4.verse: but just as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the gospel, so we speak, not to please man, but God who tests our hearts.

5.verse: For we never came with flattering speech, as you know, or with a pretext for greed—God is our witness.

6.verse: Neither did we seek praise from men, whether from you or from others.

7.verse: Although we could have made demands as apostles of Christ, we were gentle among you, like a mother tenderly nursing her own children.

8.verse: So deep was our affection for you that we were pleased to share with you not only the gospel of God but our own selves as well, so dear had you become to us.

9.verse: For you recall, brothers, our labor and toil. We worked night and day so as not to become a burden to any of you, while proclaiming to you the gospel of God.

10.verse: You are witnesses, and so is God, how devout, upright, and blameless was our conduct toward you believers—

11.verse: how, as you know, we treated each one of you as a father would treat his own children.

12.verse: So we exhorted you, encouraged you, and charged you to conduct yourselves in a manner worthy of God, who calls you into his own kingdom and glory.

13.verse: And for this reason we also constantly thank God, that when you received the word of God which you heard from us, you accepted it not as a human word, but as it truly is, the word of God, which even now is doing its work in you who believe.

14.verse: For you, brothers, became imitators of the churches of God in Christ Jesus which are in Judea; because you too suffered the same things from your own countrymen, even as they did from the Jews,

15.verse: who killed the Lord Jesus and the prophets, and have driven us out, who are displeasing to God and oppose all mankind,

16.verse: who prevent us from speaking to the Gentiles that they might be saved. Their goal has always been to complete the full number of their sins. But God’s wrath has caught up with them at last!

17.verse: As for us, brothers, when we were separated from you for a short time—in person but not in heart—we were all the more eager, with intense longing, to see you in person.

18.verse: For we wanted to come to you—I, Paul, time and again—but Satan hindered us.

19.verse: For what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing before our Lord Jesus at his coming? Is it not indeed you?

20.verse: Yes, you are our glory and joy!

1.verse: So when we could bear it no longer, we decided to remain behind at Athens alone,

2.verse: and we sent Timothy, our brother and coworker for God in the gospel of Christ, to establish and encourage you in your faith,

3.verse: so that no one would be moved by these afflictions. For you yourselves know that we were destined for this.

4.verse: In fact, when we were with you, we told you in advance that we would suffer persecution; even as it has turned out, as you know.

5.verse: So because I could bear it no longer, I sent to find out about your faith; for fear that somehow the tempter had tempted you and our labor had been in vain.

6.verse: But just now Timothy has come to us from you, and has brought us the good news of your faith and your love; and that you always think of us with affection and long to see us even as we long to see you.

7.verse: So in all our distress and affliction, brothers, we have been reassured about you by your faith.

8.verse: For now we live, if you stand firm in the Lord.

9.verse: For what thanksgiving can we return to God for you, for all the joy with which we rejoice before our God because of you?

10.verse: Night and day we pray most earnestly that we may see your face and supply what is lacking in your faith.

11.verse: Now may our God and Father himself, and our Lord Jesus, direct our way to you.

12.verse: And may the Lord cause you to increase and abound in love for one another and for all, even as we do for you,

13.verse: so as to establish your hearts blameless in holiness before our God and Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints.

1.verse: Finally, then, brothers, we ask and urge you in the Lord Jesus, that as you received from us how you ought to live so as to please God (even as you are doing), that you do so more and more.

2.verse: For you know what commands we gave you by the authority of the Lord Jesus.

3.verse: For this is the will of God—your sanctification: that you abstain from sexual immorality,

4.verse: that each of you learn how to maintain control over his own “vessel” in holiness and honor,

5.verse: not with the passion of lust, like the Gentiles who do not know God.

6.verse: No one should sin against or take advantage of his brother in this matter, because the Lord is the avenger in all these things, as indeed we told you beforehand with solemn warning.

7.verse: For God has not called us for impurity, but in holiness.

8.verse: Consequently the one who rejects this is not rejecting man, but God, who also has given his Holy Spirit to you.

9.verse: Now with regard to brotherly love you have no need for us to write to you, for you yourselves have been taught by God how to love one another.

10.verse: Indeed you do show love toward all the brothers throughout Macedonia, but we urge you, brothers, to do so more and more.

11.verse: Make it your aim to lead a quiet life, to attend to your own affairs, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you.

12.verse: In this way you will live a proper life before outsiders and be dependent on no one.

13.verse: Now we do not want you to be uninformed, brothers, about those who are asleep, so that you will not grieve as others do who have no hope.

14.verse: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, so also do we believe that God will bring with him those who have fallen asleep in Jesus.

15.verse: For this we say to you by the word of the Lord, that we who are alive, who remain behind until the coming of the Lord, will by no means precede those who have fallen asleep,

16.verse: because the Lord himself will descend from heaven with a cry of command, with the voice of an archangel, and with the trumpet of God, and the dead in Christ will rise first.

17.verse: Then we who are alive, who remain behind, will be caught up in the clouds together with them to meet the Lord in the air. And so we will be forever with the Lord.

18.verse: So encourage one another with these words.

1.verse: Now concerning the times and the seasons, brothers, you have no need for anything to be written to you,

2.verse: for you yourselves know full well that the day of the Lord will come like a thief by night.

3.verse: When they are saying, “Peace and security,” it is then that sudden destruction will come upon them, like labor pains upon a woman with child, and they will not escape.

4.verse: But you, brothers, are not in darkness, for that day to take you by surprise like a thief;

5.verse: for you are all sons of light, sons of the day. We do not belong to night or darkness.

6.verse: So then let us not fall asleep as others do; rather let us stay awake and be sober.

7.verse: For those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who get drunk, are drunk at night;

8.verse: but let us who belong to the daylight stay sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and as a helmet the hope of salvation.

9.verse: For God has not appointed us for wrath, but to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ,

10.verse: who died for us, so that whether we are awake or asleep we will come to life together with him.

11.verse: Therefore encourage one another and build one another up, as indeed you are doing.

12.verse: Now we ask you, brothers, to respect those who work tirelessly among you, care for you in the Lord, and instruct you;

13.verse: and to esteem them very highly in love because of their work. Be at peace among yourselves.

14.verse: Now we appeal to you, brothers, admonish the disorderly, comfort the discouraged, help the weak, be patient toward all.

15.verse: See that no one pays back anyone evil for evil, but always pursue what is good both for one another and for all.

18.verse: give thanks in everything, for this is God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.

20.verse: do not scoff at prophetic utterances,

21.verse: but test everything, hold fast what is good,

22.verse: abstain from evil of every kind.

23.verse: Now may the God of peace himself sanctify you completely, and may your spirit, soul, and body be preserved completely whole and blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

24.verse: The one who calls you is faithful, and he will surely do it.

26.verse: Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss.

27.verse: I ask you to swear by the name of the Lord to have this letter read to all the brothers.

28.verse: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
